Empires & Puzzles Costumed Jequn Review: The Gilded Enigma Strikes Back

Jequn is back with a flashy new 'Gilded' costume that trades his Monk robes for Rogue daggers. With a massive health boost and sharpened debuffs, the Cosmic Enigma is trying to solve the puzzle of modern power creep. Is the upgrade from 'Archaic' to 'Golden' enough to make him a staple again?
Costumed Jequn Review: All That Glitters Is Actually Gold?
Costumed Jequn: All That Glitters Is Actually Gold?
Jequn, the once-feared speedster of the Super Elemental family, has returned with a "Gilded" costume that aims to fix his biggest flaw: obsolescence. Released in mid-2025,

transforms from a fragile glass cannon into a sturdy, evasive disruptive force. With a massive health pool and the Rogue class, he’s no longer just a "Very Fast" suicide bomber—he’s a "Very Fast" problem that refuses to go away.

The "Gilded Enigma" lives up to the name. Jequn has traded his mystic blue vibes for a pristine white and gold ensemble. The art features sharper lines and a more aggressive stance, holding a geometric artifact that looks like a high-end perfume bottle or a deadly weapon—knowing Empires & Puzzles, it's definitely the latter. The shift from the calm Monk aesthetic to the flashy Rogue look signals his new role: he's here to dodge your attacks and look expensive doing it.
The costume provides the stat modernization Jequn desperately needed.
This is a spectacular number. Base Jequn had ~1900 HP; the costume pushes him well over 2500, making him a meat shield that can actually take a hit.
A respectable increase. While not hitting the 1350+ heights of the absolute newest snipers, 1213 is solid for a Very Fast AoE hero.
Still his weakest stat, but the massive HP pool compensates for it. He’s no longer "glassy," more like "reinforced plexiglass."
is a polished version of the original, with numbers tweaked for the modern era.
A slight bump from the original 200%. At Very Fast speed, this is reliable chip damage. You aren't wiping teams with this, but you are softening them up for your slower, harder hitters.
All elemental debuffs have been increased from -34% to -39%.
Nearly a 40% miss rate is significant. It disrupts the enemy's ability to retaliate effectively.
This is a huge defense down. If you catch a Blue hero with this, they are effectively dead to any follow-up tile match.
Extremely easy to reach the 6-tile breakpoint (3 ghosted tiles).
chance (20%), his effective survivability is much higher than his stats suggest. If he dodges a sniper shot (e.g., 1500 damage), that's effectively infinite HP for that turn.
He hits roughly 15-20% harder than his base version, but the real value is doing it
Family Bonus, Passives, Aether Power & Unique Abilities
family bonus (Power Gems) remains a nice perk for stacking yellows. It adds unavoidable damage that accumulates over time—perfect for a hero who is designed to fire multiple times in a match.
(Costume Buff!): The costume increases this passive from +100% to
. This is insane for Titans. His tiles against Purple enemies are nuclear.

over the Base version's Counterattack. For a Very Fast hero, the biggest enemy is getting silenced or mana-stopped before you can fire. Ailment Immunity guarantees he gets his first (and likely second) special off without interruption.
Costumed Jequn is a successful modernization. He doesn't set a new benchmark for damage, but he brings a beloved mechanic (Very Fast disruption) up to par with 2025 survival standards.
teams where you need speed to counter a bad board. He is no longer a "must-have" defense hero, but he is a "happy-to-have" utility knife.

Rogue Dodge is generally better for survival than Monk withstand, especially given his Aether Power already gives him Ailment Immunity for the first 6 turns (making the Monk class redundant early on).
The costume has significantly better stats.
The costume boosts the Troop Mastery passive to 150%, making him the superior Titan choice as well.
There is almost no scenario where you would run the Base version over the Costume.
Maximizes his high HP and patches his defense. Keeps him alive to keep dodging.
Sacrifices some of that sweet +150% tile damage potential.
Goes all-in on the Attack stat to maximize the +150% elemental damage passive against Titans.
Makes him squishier in raids, relying entirely on the Rogue dodge to survive.
if you prioritize Titans (he is a god there).
if you use him primarily for Wars/Raids.
The +150% Elemental Damage passive on the costume is top-tier for Purple Titans.
Ailment Immunity covers his biggest weakness (Control) during the opening turns.
The chance to Dodge damage and status effects adds a layer of RNG frustration for the enemy.
-39% to key stats (Accuracy, Defense, Mana) can shut down specific threats efficiently.
Even with the costume boost, 1104 Defense is on the lower side for a 5-star in 2025. He relies on HP and Dodge.
You can't choose which debuff you apply; the enemy element dictates it.
210% is still support-level damage. He cannot be your primary killer.
Absolute S-Tier thanks to the boosted passive.
Very Fast heroes are usually wasted in Rush, but his specific debuffs and Ailment Immunity make him very strong here regardless.
A safety valve hero. If the board is bad, 3 ghosted tiles can get him firing to blind or def-down enemies.
Costumed Jequn - Slot 2 - Tank - Slot 4 - Slot 5
Placing him on the Wing or Flank allows him to annoy attackers with Dodge while peppering them with debuffs.
Costumed Jequn - Guardian Jackal - C. Leonidas - Ranvir - Vivica
Jequn's tile damage will likely be the highest on the team due to his passive.
As with the base version, a cleanser removes his debuffs. However, at Very Fast speed, he can often re-apply them before the cleanser charges again.
This is a jackpot pull. A hero that works on Titans, Farms fast, and dominates early raids? Max him immediately.
hero. You might not put him on your primary defense anymore, but you will use him every single Purple Titan and likely in every War. The +150% passive is the real reason to invest here.
The community reaction to the costume was generally positive, noting the stat fix.
"The stats are very good... At least he gives defense down to blues so you can stack against such a team."
Many players noted that while the skill didn't change drastically, the
was the real "buff" he needed to stay relevant.
Costumed Jequn proves that sometimes, all you need is a fresh coat of paint (and about 600 extra Health points) to stay in the game. He isn't the terrifying monster he was in 2022, but the

has successfully transitioned him into a high-utility specialist. Whether he's dodging snipers in wars or crushing Purple Titans with enhanced tiles, he’s a puzzle piece that still fits in many teams.
A fantastic update. Essential for Titans, solid for PvP.
